author: mariusvanderwijden
content: This is only for sepolia, once we have a mainnet date, we will create a new release

author: cheerful_piglet_95568
content: thanks. I am interested in goerli and mainnet. I see that the above release involves change from levelDB to pebble. Is that something we can expect with mainnet also? We run archival nodes and syncing from scratch takes weeks to complete.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: At some point yes, but pebble support is optional at the moment. We will also switch to a path-based storage scheme soon (also optional at first) so you will need to resync at some point in the next year probably

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: But then your archive node will take less space and be faster (hopefully)

author: tersec
content: Will pebble still need pruning?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yes, we need offline pruning at the moment because we don't know at runtime which trie nodes we can safely delete. With PBSS (path-based storage scheme) we know exactly what to prune. Pebble is just a different database implementation, but doesn't change _how_ we store the data
